reviews.text: we stayed the hotel for 11 night over christmas time with our baby.
reviews.title: great view

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit far from the main area, but we often walked from the hotel to the main street which is about 30 mins. There is a hotel bus but only twice a day. Sometime we are waiting to be picked up from main street, but they did not come..... Taxi is quite expensive considering the nepal price is not so high
reviews.title: Shangri-la lives up to its name.

reviews.text: I love the hotel decoration and garden. Hotel is located in a quieter area and the view from the hotel and room was fantastic. We could see the himalayas from our room.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Pokhara,definetely 5 star category and Clean

reviews.text: As we stayed there over christmas, they run out of hot water on the peak season. (not before) I believe they do not have fully booked so often. But this is nepal, I accept how it was.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are spa in the hotel. I did not use it, but seems very nice and not so pricey.
reviews.title: A proper hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Set in a true village setting, the ShangriLa Pokhara is right in the middle of fields and houses - not along a main road, but within the village. The ‘cottage’ style rooms are quite charming and the green lawns with hammock and small ponds make it quite relaxing. Our room was facing the mountain range (I believe all do) – but monsoon was just receding so we were not able to see the now clad mountain range. Such a pity coz just the glimpse of peaks we got from behind the clouds indicated how divine the full view of Annapurna would be.
reviews.title: A quiet retreat

reviews.text: The hotel is located fairly close to the airport and is only about a 5-10 mts drive to Phewa lake and main shopping area. Taxis are easily available. The shopping are by the lake is buzzing till late evening (and we went in low season) – highly recommended places to dine are Moondance restaurant and Maya restaurant. Shopping prices tend to be higher than KTM as most items are brought from there – so if you have KTM in your itinerary then shop there. There is also an abundance of massage parlors, fairly cheap, you can try the foot reflexology after a long walk.
reviews.title: a lovely place in Pokhara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One highly recommended day excursion is a trip to Sarangkot for paragliding. Its great fun. There are also some half/full day treks available for the amateur, but we couldn’t take them so cant say. There is also a casino at the Pokhara Grande for the gamblers, though my suggestion would be to enjoy the quiet evenings and leave the gambling for KTM.
reviews.title: A stunning moment in Shangri-la - when I first saw the Fishtail mountain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly don’t miss the take off and landings from the Pokhara airport. After check-in go to their rooftop restaurant and watch the planes land and depart – its an amazing experience and among the closest views you will get from any airport. To get the best views of the mountains, sit on the right side of the flight on way to Pokhara and on the left (seats AB I think) on way back to KTM.
reviews.title: Not a great hotel, but then again you are in Nepal..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall, when in Nepal, a visit to Pokhara is highly recommended. And when in Pokhara, the Shangri-la is among the best resort style hotels to stay.
reviews.title: Does not correspond to other Shangri-La hotel service level

reviews.text: The ShangriLa Pokhara is set amidst fields and houses--it is not along a main road, but rather deep into a subdivision of sorts and that is what partly explains its charms. It is quiet, spread out and absolutely charming.
reviews.title: Away from the maddening crowd--and a joy through out.
Reasonable hotel
reviews.text: On our first stint here, we were not lucky enough to see the Annapurna range--a view from each room as promised by the brochure--but the grounds and hotel were lovely indeed. Clean, spacious rooms in a charming orange vibe, comfortable beds and rather large bathrooms. The airconditioning takes a while to work--we had to call housekeeping to tinker with it a couple of times, but it turned cool eventually. The rooms are spread out in a T-formation, mostly to maximize the view which we eventually caught on our second leg.

Yes, the sunrise is amazing--and with Fishtail mountain and the Annapurna range as a backdrop, the hotel is pretty wonderful. The pool was nicely maintained, the grounds are impeccable, trees and plants bloom profusely.
reviews.title: Lovely setting but ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was especially good--I had the pepper steak which was excellent. My friends had the Indian buffet which, according to them was very good too. The hotel was in full occupancy when we were there--and yet it wasn't too hectic--except maybe through breakfast--but then again, it still wasn't as crazy as Hongkong or Bangkok. Choices were varied and delectable. And service was excellent--the waiters were warm, polite and swift.
reviews.title: Gotta love this place

reviews.text: I also sampled the spa--mostly just a nice room with beds--but the massage was pretty good relief after the trek we made. There are charming shops with finer tourist fare--but expect pricier goods of course.
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful and huge sprawling property filled with greenery, flowers and streams with fish and the loveliest views from the rooms. It is quite big so its a bit of a walk for most from the room to the main area. The breakfast area is set beautifully under an awning of flowers by the pool and facing the mountain and the buffet is standard though nothing exceptional.
reviews.title: Beautiful property with lovely views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and big enough and the loo though small is nice and clean. (The shower however had no pressure.)
reviews.title: An oasis of peace and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can view the mountain tops right from your bed including the fishtail mountain and the rooms come with a small balcony overlooking the well maintained lawn.
reviews.title: Beautiful property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt order room service but the dinner buffet was quite nice.
reviews.title: best place to stay in pokhara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool looked lovely and inviting though we didnt take a dip, several people were. The staff were smiling and pleasant. Overall a nice experience in a very beautiful property. Only wish we could have stayed more!
reviews.title: The best hotel & resort in Pokhara...
Lovely Hotel in a lovely setting
reviews.text: This hotel was lovely the rooms were clean, modern and comfortable all with fantastic views of the himalayas. My only complaint was the noise of aircraft arriving and departing from the local airport.
